title: 2009년 Cook 사건
summary: 미국 Maine, ME 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Cook. 판결일: 2009-12-08. 법원: Supreme Judicial Court of Maine.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: STATE of Maine v. Christopher Michael COOK
**판결일**: 2009-12-08
**법원**: Supreme Judicial Court of Maine
**관할**: Maine, ME

**판사**: Alexander, Gorman, Jabar, Levy, Mead, Saufley, Silver

## 변호인

Clifford B. Strike, Esq. (orally), Strike, Goodwin & O’Brien, Portland, ME, for Christopher M. Cook., Norman R. Croteau, District Attorney, Deborah Potter Cashman, Asst. Dist. Atty. (orally), Office of the District Attorney, Auburn, ME, for the State of Maine.

## 인용

- 2009 ME 119
- 984 A.2d 1272

## 판결문 요약


984 A.2d 1272 (2009)
2009 ME 119
STATE of Maine
v.
Christopher Michael COOK.
Docket: And-09-78
Supreme Judicial Court of Maine.
Argued: October 30, 2009.
Decided: December 8, 2009.
Clifford B. Strike, Esq. (orally), Strike, Goodwin & O'Brien, Portland, ME, for Christopher M. Cook.
Norman R. Croteau, District Attorney, Deborah Potter Cashman, Asst. Dist. Atty. (orally), Office of the District Attorney, Auburn, ME, for the State of Maine.
Panel: SAUFLEY, C.J., and ALEXANDER, LEVY, SILVER, MEAD, GORMAN, and JABAR, JJ.
SILVER, J.
[¶ 1] Christopher Michael Cook appeals from a judgment entered in the Superior Court (Androscoggin County, Delahanty, J.), following a jury trial, convicting him of robbery (Class B), 17-A M.R.S. § 651(1)(B)(2) (2008). The court found Cook guilty on a charge of violating a condition of release (Class E), 15 M.R.S. § 1092(1)(A) (2008). Cook had waived a jury trial on that charge, and it is not at issue in this appeal. Cook argues that the court erred in proceeding with the trial when jurors may have been distracted due to bad weather. Cook also moved for a mistrial, arguing that the jury may not have been impartial given that some jurors expressed concern that they might have been photographed by a friend of Cook as they were leaving the courthouse. The court denied the motion. We affirm the judgment.
[¶ 2] The trial began with opening statements on Tuesday, December 9, 2008, and testimony from various witnesses was presented on December 9, 10, and 1...
